intro: Roulinia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered roulinia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The plant features opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Roulinia parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
